After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You have the following:
✑ A Microsoft 365 E5 tenant
✑ An on-premises Active Directory domain
✑ A hybrid Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenant
✑ An Azure Active Directory Domain Services (Azure AD DS) managed domain
✑ An Azure Virtual Desktop deployment
The Azure Virtual Desktop deployment contains personal desktops that are hybrid joined to the on-premises domain and enrolled in Microsoft Intune.
You need to configure the security settings for the Microsoft Edge browsers on the personal desktops.
Solution: You configure a Group Policy Object (GPO) in the Azure AD DS managed domain.
Does this meet the goal?

discussion.content:

Selected Answer: A
No, this solution does not meet the goal.

Since the personal desktops are hybrid joined and enrolled in Microsoft Intune, the recommended approach is to use Intune to manage and configure the security settings for Microsoft Edge. This ensures that the settings are applied consistently across all devices, regardless of their network location.

Configuring a Group Policy Object (GPO) in the Azure AD DS managed domain would not be as effective because it would only apply to devices when they are connected to the Azure AD DS domain, which might not cover all scenarios for hybrid-joined devices.

A is correct because configuring a configuration profile in Intune to manage the security settings for Microsoft Edge browsers on the personal desktops does meet the goal. Intune allows you to create and deploy configuration profiles that can enforce security settings and policies on devices, including those that are hybrid joined and enrolled in Intune. This approach ensures that the security settings are consistently applied across all personal desktops in your Azure Virtual Desktop deployment.

Selected Answer: B
Based on the scenario provided and best practices for managing devices enrolled in Intune, Solution B: No, configuring a GPO in the Azure AD DS managed domain does not meet the goal of configuring the security settings for Microsoft Edge browsers on the personal desktops in your AVD deployment. Instead, you should use Intune configuration profiles to define and enforce the desired security settings for Microsoft Edge on these devices. This approach ensures effective management and compliance with organizational security policies in a modern management environment.

You need to deploy the Microsoft Remote Desktop client (MSRDC) to the devices. The MSRDC must be available to everyone who sign in to the devices.

discussion.content: Got this question on exam today.

A. Install the MSRDC by using msiexec.exe and the ALLUSERS=1 command line option.

Using the ALLUSERS=1 option installs the application for all users on the device, making it available to anyone who logs in
